subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: Coca-Cola's Timeless Script
description: A 60-second lesson on Coca-Cola's Timeless Script.

hook.text: The Coca-Cola logo hasn't fundamentally changed since 1887. That's 137 years of consistency.

buildup.text: Frank Robinson, the company's bookkeeper, wrote the name in Spencerian script ‚Äî a popular penmanship style.

discovery.text: The flowing script conveys warmth, nostalgia, and handcrafted quality ‚Äî even on a mass-produced bottle.

twist.text: In 1985, 'New Coke' changed the formula but kept the logo. The logo survived; the formula didn't.

climax.text: Coca-Cola is recognized by 94% of the world's population. The logo is the most known design on Earth.

punchline.text: The most powerful logo is the one you never redesign.

quiz.question: Who designed the original Coca-Cola script?
